info.author: Michael Kluge
info.description: sequences (and qualities) of FASTQ files can be added to SAM files
info.comments: for large files a lot of memory is required as the complete FASTQ file is indexed first in order to keep disk I/O load small; might be changed in the future
some of the required packages are include in watchdog/core_lib/perl

param.name: output
param.description: path to the output SAM file in which the sequences are added

param.name: unmapped
param.description: path to a FASTQ file in which the unmapped sequences will be written to; exclusive with --preread flag

param.name: noquality
param.description: does not add the read quality values

param.name: preread
param.description: does only index reads stored in the FASTQ file that are part of the SAM file; exclusive with --unmapped parameter

var.name: SAMFileWithSequences
var.description: absolute path to the SAM file with added sequences and, if enabled, qualities

var.name: UnmappedReadFile
var.description: absolute path to file containing all unmapped reads in FASTQ format
